alert.note: Alert for Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 10:55PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Osage County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1055 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Sunset Lake to 9 miles west of Wynona. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Pawhuska... Barnsdall... Osage Hills State Park... Bartlesville Municipal Airport... Okesa... Pershing... Nelagoney... Tallant... Wolco... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
